      ) An economy can increase the production of one good without reducing the output of another good if:
      1 pt
      Multiple Choice
      Expand Preview
      Add to this assessment
       ✔ Used Elsewhere ▼

      • Use in existing assessment
      • USED IN:
      • End of Chapter Questions
      An economy can increase the production of one good without reducing the output of another good if:
      • there are no unemployed resources and the economy is operating within the production possibilities frontier.
      • there are no unemployed resources and the economy is operating outside the production possibilities frontier.
      • there are unemployed resources and the economy is operating within the production possibilities frontier.
      • there are unemployed resources and the economy is operating outside the production possibilities frontier.

    • ) The difference between a straight line PPF and a bowed PPF is:

      The difference between a straight line PPF and a bowed PPF is:
      • a straight line PPF has constant opportunity cost whereas a bowed PPF has increasing opportunity costs.
      • a straight line PPF has increasing opportunity costs whereas a bowed PPF has constant opportunity costs.
      • a straight line PPF has constant opportunity costs whereas a bowed PPF has decreasing opportunity costs.
      • a straight line PPF has decreasing opportunity costs whereas a bowed PPF has constant opportunity costs.
